author: taipan303
content:
Hi guys, to build prysm for a devnet node (this https://github.com/Inphi/prysm/tree/inphi/clean-slate) is it still OK to use Bazel as recommended by the Prysm team? The reason I ask is because it's trying to import some files from the main build instead of the fork, e.g. "import of "github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain/core/blob"" and "import of "github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain/core/blocks".
If we can't use Bazel, is someone able to share the method to get go to compile everything, without having to compile each subfolder individually? I'm not familiar with go

author: nishant0
content:
you can just download/install go , then do 
```
go run ./cmd/beacon-chain
```
and you should be able to run prysm

author: nishant0
content: although would recommend running go 1.18.5 for now, we arent fully compatible with 1.19

author: taipan303
content:
Great thanks, I wasn't sure how go would work with the dependencies without some sort of file. I'm on 1.18.1 which seems ok so far.
I assume I'll do the same for the validator build.

author: nishant0
content: the source code has a go.mod file, so that tells go everything it needs

author: nishant0
content: yeap, validatot should work the same
